response.overview: ~ Mā te Moana ~ holds multiple narratives concurrently. As a descendant of Te Arawa waka, Kahurangiariki has spent months learning the many intersecting genealogical connections to the outer islands of Kuki ‘Āirani. Living within swimming distance of where many ancestral waka departed for Aotearoa, she has been researching these connections while living in Rarotonga. Gazing upon the very same horizon and swimming in the same waters as her ancestors once would have done. This narrative is held alongside the words of Buntheun Oung, who speaks to his returning to the homeland of Cambodia.
response.title: ~ Mā te Moana ~
